conclusion: Use properties of an ideal gas and p-V diagram to solve the problem
p-V diagram shows pressure and volume of gas at different states

Identify states and given data: State A: p_A = 3x10^5 Pa, V_A = 1x10^-3 m^3; State B: p_B = 1x10^5 Pa, V_B = 1x10^-3 m^3; State C: p_C = 1x10^5 Pa, V_C = 3x10^-3 m^3; Temperature at state A, T_A = 27Â°C = 300 K
Use ideal gas law pV = nRT to find temperature at state B
Use relationship p1V1/T1 = p2V2/T2 for ideal gas
Process from A to B is isochoric (constant volume), V_A = V_B
Use ideal gas law for isochoric process: p_A/T_A = p_B/T_B
Substitute known values: (3x10^5 Pa)/(300 K) = (1x10^5 Pa)/T_B
Solve for T_B: T_B = (1x10^5 Pa x 300 K)/(3x10^5 Pa) = 100 K
Verify temperature at state C using p-V diagram and ideal gas law
Process from B to C is isobaric (constant pressure), p_B = p_C
Use ideal gas law for isobaric process: V_B/T_B = V_C/T_C
Substitute known values: (1x10^-3 m^3)/(100 K) = (3x10^-3 m^3)/T_C
Conclusion: Temperature at state B is 100 K
